info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 09 at 9:56AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF UPPER YAMPA RIVER BASIN...ELKHEAD AND PARK MOUNTAINS...AND CENTRAL YAMPA RIVER BASIN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of up to 35 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...This band of heavier snowfall is bringing slick roads to the U.S. Highway 40 corridor west of Hayden and will be moving east towards Steamboat Springs shortly. This area is moving east at 35 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Craig, Steamboat Springs, Hayden, Milner and Tow Creek. This includes U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 93 and 135. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
